hook.text: Two buildings cost the same, but one has a 4% cap rate and the other 8%. Which is better?

buildup.text: Cap rate equals net operating income divided by property price. It measures return before financing.

discovery.text: A higher cap rate means higher income relative to priceâ€”but often signals higher risk or worse location.

twist.text: Prime downtown offices trade at 4% caps while rural strip malls trade at 9%. Risk drives the gap.

climax.text: Compare cap rates within the same market and asset type, never across them blindly.

punchline.text: Cap rate tells you the yield; your job is to judge the risk.

quiz.question: How is cap rate calculated?
options: Net operating income divided by price
